concepts.name: Real Numbers
concepts.description: A set of numbers including integers, fractions, and irrational numbers, represented on the number line.

concepts.name: Integers
concepts.description: Counting numbers, their negatives, and zero, represented without fractions or decimals.

concepts.name: Rational Numbers
concepts.description: Numbers expressed as the ratio of two integers, including fractions and finite or repeating decimals.

concepts.name: Graphing Integers
concepts.description: Plotting integers on the number line to visually compare their magnitudes.

concepts.name: Absolute Value
concepts.description: The distance of a number from zero on the number line, always non-negative.

concepts.name: Addition and Subtraction of Rational Numbers
concepts.description: Combining or separating fractions using common denominators, respecting properties like the inverse relationship of addition and subtraction.

concepts.name: Multiplication and Division of Rational Numbers
concepts.description: Combining rational numbers by multiplying numerators and denominators, or dividing using reciprocal rules.

concepts.name: Properties of Arithmetic
concepts.description: Rules including commutative, associative, distributive, and identity properties that simplify operations on numbers.

concepts.name: Square Roots
concepts.description: Finding a number that, when multiplied by itself, equals a given number; involves integers, perfect squares, and irrational results.

concepts.name: Problem-Solving Strategies
concepts.description: Methods such as guess and check, and working backwards, to solve real-world mathematical problems.

concepts.name: Real-World Applications of Rational Numbers
concepts.description: Using rational numbers and arithmetic operations to model and solve practical problems, like calculating distances or costs.

concepts.name: Classification of Numbers
concepts.description: Organizing numbers into categories like integers, rational, or irrational, based on their properties.

concepts.name: Additive and Multiplicative Inverses
concepts.description: Concepts where numbers combined with their inverse (additive: -a, multiplicative: 1/a) result in identity elements (0 or 1).

concepts.name: Distributive Property
concepts.description: A property allowing the multiplication of a term across a sum or difference inside parentheses.
